title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire - BBC News
summary: two in hospital after chemical leak .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on tuesday , after the bank holiday , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: on midlands today from 18:30 : preparing for the bank holiday getaway
text: it 's the great bank holiday getaway and for once it 's looking good .
things were running smoothly at birmingham airport this morning , despite a record number of passengers .
and on the roads , there 's encouraging news at some of the west midland 's main bottlenecks .
will it last ?
i 'll have the latest on midlands today from 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Sarah Falkland
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : carding mill valley from the air
text: midlands today 's midlands from the air series has turned the spotlight on carding mill valley in south shropshire.drone cameraman joe barrett and weather presenter rebecca wood visited the hills at church stretton to see how the national trust is attracting wildlife back .
find out more from 18:30 on bbc one .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: telford tigers getting ready for ice hockey return
text: telford tigers face a friendly against milton keynes lightning this weekend as the countdown to the english premier league season continues .
they 've had two training sessions a day during pre-season , and are expecting a tough test against the buckinghamshire side , which they expect to challenge for silverware this year .
tigers coach tom watkins has been impressed with his squad 's efforts during those opening sessions , and expects more of the same this weekend .
the guys are of course tired and a little sore in places , but you have got to expect that .
they 've had a great attitude to what has been a very tough week . ''

documents.title: lib dems select candidates in case of a general election
text: a member of shropshire council has been selected to fight the next general election for the liberal democrats in the shrewsbury and atcham seat , currently held by daniel kawczynski .
councillor hannah fraser 's selection has been made in case there happens to be a general election before the spring .
meanwhile , 21-year-old tom thornhill ( above ) , who ran against owen paterson last year , has been selected for the lib dems in north shropshire .

documents.title: six inhale fumes after ammonia leak at shropshire abattoir
text: six people were treated by paramedics after an ammonia leak at an abattoir in shropshire today .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: watch : weather forecast - a damp weekend
text: this evening will be dry with some good sunny spells .
tomorrow , after a dry morning , outbreaks of rain will affect us during the afternoon .
the rain will become heavy and prolonged at times , with a risk of thunder .
maximum temperature : 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: headlines : two in hospital due to chemical fumes ; heavy traffic as folk festival opens
text: as we head into the evening , these are the the main news stories in shropshire :
- two people in hospital after ammonia leak at hordley meat processing factory
- congestion around shrewsbury town centre as hundreds head to the folk festival
- classic car restoration business passed over to its 60 employees .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pair in hospital after chemical leak at shropshire food firm
text: two people are being treated in hospital after inhaling ammonia fumes at a meat processing plant near ellesmere .
it comes after a fridge unit burst at the abp food group site in hordley this morning , allowing the chemical to leak .
a man and a woman have since been taken to the royal shrewsbury hospital suffering with throat irritation .

documents.title: congestion as traffic heads to shrewsbury folk festival
text: the shrewsbury folk festival means there 's heavier traffic than usual on smithfield road .
it 's particularly busy near the a488 mardol quay junction .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: shrewsbury folk festival gets under way
text: shrewsbury 's folk festival is one of many bank holiday activities happening across the county this weekend , including ellesmere rocks and the jackfield sunflower festival .
it 's also the event 's 20th year this year , and it seems the celebratory mood has hit the west midlands showground already .
when you ca n't wait for the music to start .
just start playing !
# shrewsfolk

documents.title: your photos : myddle and telford
text: it looks a lovely day across shropshire as these views of myddle ( top ) and telford from regular bbc weather watchers len ticular and raj 's range show .
we 'd love to feature your photos - email them , tweet us on @ twitterid message via facebook .

documents.title: weekend rain : bad news , good news
text: the bad news is there 's going to be heavy rain this weekend , according to the met office - the good news is there 's a low risk of surface flooding .
chance of very heavy rain this weekend .
low risk of significant surface water flooding across our patch .
# floodaware

documents.title: striker wants more goals to add to shrewsbury 's first of the season
text: shrewsbury town 's first league goal of the season against chesterfield last week has been awarded to striker ivan toney .
junior brown claimed it at the time , but the club now recognises that toney got the final touch , and he wants to use it as the springboard for more .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: housing firm pledges to take 'prompt action ' over mouldy shrewsbury flats
text: severnside housing says it will take `` prompt action '' to sort any issues staff find in flats in the meole area of shrewsbury .
both the local mp daniel kawczynski , and councillor nic laurens have raised concerns about the property below , which is used as social housing .
the tenant living in the flat , shireen walker says there have been problems with mould and damp for several years .
the company says it will carry out an inspection within the next week , but is happy to visit sooner .

documents.title: accident causing delays exiting m54
text: traffic is slow coming off the m54 , heading southbound onto the m6 .
it follows an accident involving a car and a lorry .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: cctv images released after attempted robbery at bridgnorth bar
text: two men tried to steal spirits from a bridgnorth bar and then knocked the spectacles off a member of staff when he confronted them .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: headlines : chemical leak leaves two in hospital ; telford and wrekin council homes complete
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this afternoon :
- two people in hospital after inhaling chemical fumes at an abattoir near ellesmere
- first telford homes built by council in randlay
- housing firm responds to calls to demolish mouldy flat in shrewsbury

documents.title: weather : plenty of sunshine to enjoy
text: it 's a warm afternoon with blue skies .
we have highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: university centre shrewsbury expecting near 200 students
text: preparations are under way for the arrival of university centre shrewsbury 's second intake of undergraduates next month .
just over 80 have filled places for next year , more than double the number enrolled at the same time last year .
applications are still expected through the clearing process - and with postgraduate places also available - it 's expected that the total student community will be close to 200 .

documents.title: shropshire part of the 'nation 's biggest sports day '
text: the olympic games may have finished a week ago , but our enjoyment of sport does n't have to end there .
that 's the message ahead of what 's being dubbed the `` nation 's biggest sports day '' tomorrow .
the i am team gb event will feature cricket , football , rugby , swimming , tennis and wheelchair tennis , all happening for free at the shrewsbury club .

documents.title: telford united captain confident of building momentum
text: telford captain luca havern says the team has the quality to string together a sequence of positive results .
the bucks play stockport tomorrow and nuneaton on monday , after an inconsistent start to the national league north season .
we look solid at times , the lads all know what they need to do , i think we 've got more than enough quality in there to start going on a bit of a run . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: first telford homes built by council
text: the first of telford and wrekin council 's new homes have been completed .
the authority formed a private company last year , in a bid to build hundreds of extra of properties in the borough .
thirty one homes have now been completed at pool view in randlay by developers lovell , on behalf of the council 's firm nuplace .
the randlay homes , on the edge of telford town park , are all fully let .
work is ongoing on a similar development in madeley , with others in hadley and newport awaiting planning approval .

documents.title: watch : carding mill valley from the air
text: i 'm live at carding mill valley tonight on bbc midlands today , but take a look at this aerial view of the area .
after 50 years under national trust ownership a new 10-year plan is helping to attract wildlife back to carding mill valley and the long mynd .
tune in at 13:30 and 18:30 on bbc one for more .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: fumes inhaled during chemical leak at factory near ellesmere
text: six people are being treated for inhaling chemical fumes after a leak at a meat processing company near ellesmere .
firefighters were called to the abp food group site in hordley after hearing that part of a fridge had burst , allowing liquid ammonia to escape .
crews are now working to ventilate the building .

documents.title: accused denies stabbing telford victim
text: a man standing trial for attempted murder after another man was .
knifed repeatedly in a street told a jury `` i did n't stab him '' .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: bridgnorth business given to its staff
text: a classic car firm in bridgnorth is being handed over to its employees , who will own and run the business .
classic motor cars ltd restores old vehicles and has worked on some of the world 's rarest models .
but its chairman , peter newmark , is turning the company into an employee ownership trust in a move believed to be the first of its kind in the sector .
this is great for the staff , great for shropshire and the west midlands and great for the classic car world , which every year creates several billions for the british economy . ''
author: James Fanning
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : 'prompt ' reaction to mouldy flats pledged ; shrewsbury could have close to 200 students
text: as we head into the afternoon , these are the main stories we are working on :
- housing company to take 'prompt action ' to sort mouldy shrewsbury flats
- number of students in shrewsbury could be near 200 this year
- bridgnorth classic car firm to become an employee-owned company
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: mouldy shrewsbury flats 'not fit for purpose '
text: a block of flats in shrewsbury used as social housing should be demolished because they are `` not fit for purpose '' , a local councillor says .

the property in the meole area is owned by severnside housing , who say they pride themselves on providing high-quality , affordable accommodation and that they 'll meet with the people living there next week .
nic laurens , the councillor for meole in shrewsbury wants action to be taken as soon as possible .
rehouse the people , pull them down and build some decent social housing . ''

documents.title: tech just became a little bit greener
text: tech just became a little bit greener
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science, Environment & Rural Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: recycling and waste collections running a day late
text: a reminder that waste and recycling collections across telford and shropshire will be a day late next week , due to the bank holiday .
recycling/waste collections are a day later next week due to bank holiday .
check details
just a reminder that your waste collection will be one day later than usual next week because of the bank holiday .

documents.title: shrewsbury boss unlikely to make more signings
text: shrewsbury town boss micky mellon does n't think he 'll bring in any new players ahead of the transfer window shutting next week .
with a squad of 20 , he feels he has the flexibility to cover all positions , and believes that increasing that number could unsettle players who are n't in the team .
i like the numbers that i 've got .
you 've got to be careful that you are n't stockpiling players . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: car damaged as drivers clash in telford
text: police are appealing for witnesses to a row which ended with damage being caused to a car in telford .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: photos : shrewsbury folk festival about to get started
text: thousands of music fans are heading to shrewsbury today for this year 's folk festival .
artists from all over the world will be performing at the west midlands showground over the weekend .
i 've been to get a sneak peak , as the organisers put the finishing touches to the site .
author: Ian Perry
Reporter, BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: telford and wrekin council children 's services 'requires improvement '
text: telford and wrekin council 's been praised for its work with children at risk of sexual exploitation but needs to improve its children 's services , according to a month-long ofsted inspection .
the authority has been ranked as requiring improvement , and 11 recommendations have been flagged up .
only adoption and progress of care leavers were rated good .
even so , inspectors praised the authority for the `` important improvements '' that had been made since its last visit .
the cabinet member responsible for the service , councillor paul watling , says overall he 's pleased with the findings .
we 've gone from a position where we were being told we needed to do 34 things those 11 things are things that we had identified ourselves . ''

documents.title: headlines : calls to demolish shrewsbury flats ; telford and wrekin needs ofsted improvement
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- shropshire councillor calls for a block of flats used as social housing to be demolished
- telford and wrekin council children 's service ranked as `` requires improvement '' by ofsted
- severn hos starts fundraising by selling furniture and electrical goods

documents.title: watch : today 's weather forecast
text: watch : today 's weather forecast
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: mp 'appalled ' by some shrewsbury social housing conditions
text: a block of flats owned by severnside housing in the meole brace area , is riddled with damp and mould , residents say .
shireen walker has lived in one of them for five years and is due to have a baby in 10 weeks ' time .
she fears for the health of her children .
shrewsbury and atcham mp daniel kawczynzski says something has to be done and is calling for radical improvements to social housing .
severnside housing say they pride themselves on providing high-quality , affordable accommodation and always take prompt action when problems arise .
they 'll be meeting with ms walker next week .
author: James Fanning
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: 'high interest ' in whitchurch gp job
text: interest in providing caretaker gp services for patients in whitchurch has been high , confirmed shropshire clinical commissioning group .
author: Whitchurch Herald

documents.title: latest weather forecast
text: a dry and fine day with some blue sky and sunshine along with light winds .
highs of 21c ( 70f ) .

documents.title: headlines : calls for radical improvements at severnside housing , telford and wrekin council told to improve care for vulnerable children
text: the main stories we 're looking at this morning :
- a shropshire mp calls for radical improvements to some social housing in shrewsbury .
- telford and wrekin has been ranked as `` requiring improvement '' for how vulnerable children are looked after by the council
- shrewsbury folk festival gets under way today .
author: James Fanning
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: travel : traffic moving well across the county this morning
text: there are a few roadworks to be aware of this morning .
no major incidents or delays to report .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning - live updates from bbc shropshire
text: welcome to live updates from shropshire , we are here with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do you have a story or a to share ?
you can get in touch with us on email , facebook or twitter .
author: James Fanning
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: that 's it for today for live updates , but we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow .
keep an eye out here for more updates through the evening and into the morning .

documents.title: 'positive ' step in bid to save copthorne barracks sports pitch
text: campaigners fighting to save the playing fields by shrewsbury 's copthorne barracks say they 've had a positive response from people who live in the area .
part of the barracks site is expected to make may for housing .

the shropshire playing fields association have appealed for residents to come forward , as it 's more likely the fields will be saved from demolition if there is proof that they are used by the community .

they now say a cricket team called the copthorne stragglers have used the sports pitch for their home matches for several seasons , which means at least another seven teams from the same league will have played on the pitch each season .

documents.title: severe delays on the shropshire border near welshpool
text: an accident involving two cars means traffic is queuing on the a483 at buttington , just north of welshpool .
it 's affecting a long stretch of road from the junction with the a458 road to shrewsbury , right up as far as arddleen .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: police advise caution over 'lawsuit ' scam calls
text: west mercia police say there is a scam going around shropshire , whereby callers are told they face a lawsuit .
it involves an automated message , which asks you to press a key on your phone to speak to a caseworker .
you then get a call demanding payment over the phone .
officers say her majesty 's revenue & customs would never ring people to ask for personal or bank details over the phone - their advice is to hang up immediately .

documents.title: barmouth to be declared 'shropshire-on-sea '
text: many of you have been in touch with your memories of visiting wales over the last couple of weeks .
it 's part of our breakfast show 's search for the most popular place along the welsh coast , which can be declared `` shropshire-on-sea '' .
barmouth has come out on top , and the british ironworks centre has got on board to make a trophy or a sculpture , which will be presented to the mayor of barmouth .
suggestions you 've offered include a miniature wrekin or a model of the iron bridge .
find out which has been chosen on tomorrow 's programme .
author: Eric and Clare's Breakfast Show

documents.title: weather : this evening 's weather forecast
text: there 's still a lot of cloud around , with some heavy rain to come later .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: headlines : triathlon club warns of open water risk ; success sinks in for shropshire-based gymnastics coaches
text: as we head into the evening , these are our top stories in the newsroom :
- shropshire triathlon club urges awareness of coastal water dangers following camber sands deaths
- lilleshall-based gymnastics coaches delighted following olympic success
- schools around the county celebrate gcse results

documents.title: students celebrate gcse success
text: updates have been coming in from around the county as students receive their gcse results .
at least 43 % of pupils at the marches school in oswestry gained one or more a or a grades this year .
meanwhile , shrewsbury college says it 's seen an increase in the number of gcse passes for the third year running .

documents.title: dog charity launching fundraiser in shropshire
text: a charity which rehomes abandoned dogs has chosen one of the busiest weekends on shropshire 's calendar to launch its latest fundraiser .
finding furever homes is competing against the shrewsbury folk festival , ellesmere rocks and the onslow park steam rally .
they 're running a dog show on sunday called k9 capers in shrewsbury 's quarry park and need help from dog lovers .

documents.title: your photos : foggy day across south shropshire
text: it 's been a foggy day across the county at times today as these photos from bbc weather watchers foggy , in ludlow ( top ) and snapper simon in church stretton show .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: ironbridge museum trust fundraising to buy china
text: shropshire 's ironbridge gorge museum trust launched a campaign in early august appealing for donations to help them buy five significant pieces of coalport and caughley china .

they are hoping to raise nearly £ 12,000 , and have already raised two thirds of the funds needed , including sufficient money to purchase two coalport china plaques , exquisitely painted by john randall , one of coalport china 's most famous artists .

documents.title: plenty of nerves at telford priory school
text: despite a few nerves first thing , there have been some great gcse results among pupils at telford 's priory school , staff say .
lots of excitement and nerves !
college providers are on hand to offer guidance

documents.title: shropshire paramedic body cameras 'a possibility '
text: body cameras could be used by ambulance staff in shropshire in a bid to stop them being attacked .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: headlines : black-faced morris dancers told to consider other disguises ; road reopen after cressage accident
text: here are the local stories leading the news bulletins this afternoon :
- equality group says morris dancers should consider less offensive alternatives to black face paint
- shrewsbury to bridgnorth road has reopened after an earlier crash
- heavy rain on the way , as met office issue yellow warning
author: Faith Page
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: heavy rain on the way
text: bad news from the environment agency , with heavy rain expected to hit most of the west midlands over the next 24 hours .
stay # floodaware - heavy and thundery rain is forecast today and tomorrow increasing flood risk

documents.title: black-faced dancers urged to use 'less offensive ' alternatives
text: the equality group which complained about black-faced morris dancers at shrewsbury folk festival say there are plenty of alternatives , which would avoid the chance of causing offence .
many of you have been in touch to have your say following the festival 's decision to ban them from next year 's event .
fairness , respect , equality shropshire ( fresh ) say the tradition of projecting disguise can be continued in a less harmful way .
you do n't have to use black to do it you could use multi-coloured face paint , you could use masks all sorts of things . ''

documents.title: travel : a458 reopens at cressage
text: the a458 has reopened after an earlier crash in cressage .
diversions had been in place to allow emergency services clear the road .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: major route between shropshire and mid wales to close for 10 weeks
text: a main road from shropshire into mid wales will be closed during the day for 10 weeks , it has been announced .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: still long delays on the a458 at cressage
text: the shrewsbury to bridgnorth road has been closed for several hours after a car left the road earlier .
a person in the car had to be cut free from the wreckage .
the accident happened near the riverside inn in cressage at 09:30 this morning .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: gcse clinics in telford
text: for anyone considering their options in telford after receiving gcse results .

documents.title: shropshire man reflects on soviet coup 25 years ago
text: a man from albrighton , who was in moscow during the in the 1991 soviet coup says it was a frightening event to witness .
tanks and troops roamed the streets as members of the government tried to take control of the country from president mikhail gorbachev .
michael underwood was there for an engineering conference at the time , and took these interesting photos .

documents.title: headlines : equality group encourages using alternatives to black face paint ; mellon proud of shrewsbury players despite loss
text: - shrewsbury anti-discrimination group says alternatives to black face paint should be considered by morris dancers
- shrewsbury town boss micky mellon proud of players despite efl cup loss to sunderland
- met office issue a yellow alert for rain in shropshire this afternoon

documents.title: heading back to the 70s in bridgnorth this afternoon
text: after a summer of looking back at the summer of 1976 , we 've pulled out all the stops this afternoon .
our show is live from the bear in bridgnorth this afternoon - and at 19:00 - we are putting on a free screening of rocky at the town 's majestic cinema .
tickets will be available on the door should you wish to come along .
author: Colin Young
Presenter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : today 's weather forecast
text: there should be some improvement in the weather early this afternoon , with a chance of some heavy downpours as we head into the evening .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: rain warning for west midlands
text: drivers are being warned they could be facing heavy rain through this afternoon and evening .
the met office has issued a yellow weather warning covering most of the west midlands :
yellow alert of rain for west midlands : herefordshire , shropshire , staffordshire , stoke-on-trent , telford an

documents.title: town boss 'proud ' of players after sunderland defeat
text: shrewsbury town manager micky mellon said he was `` really , really proud '' of his players after their narrow 1-0 loss to premier league club sunderland .
`` to come here and be disappointed is a great measure of how we believe the team performed , '' he said .

of course , there 's nothing for second place , but in terms of performance and coming up here and making sure that we represent this football club properly , i could n't really have asked for any more , to be honest . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: ellesmere triathlon club stress the importance of safety in open water
text: fire crews and water companies in the midlands have both been warning about the dangers of swimming in rivers this morning .

the trismart club based in ellesmere says the temptation to cool down is understandably greater because of the warm weather , but wants people to be aware of the difference between swimming pools and open water .
you ca n't see the floor there 's currents and rip tides obviously the water looks very inviting but it 's totally different . ''

documents.title: slow traffic after accident near cressage
text: the a458 is blocked in both directions at the shore lane junction , where recovery work is ongoing following an accident .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: baby george faces a fight
text: but for an on-the-ball midwife at ludlow hospital and a mum 's decision not to race home after giving birth , a little baby from clunbury would not be here .
author: Ludlow & Tenbury Wells Advertiser

documents.title: bike lovers preparing for rally in oswestry this weekend
text: there 's a honda goldwing parade this bank holiday weekend in oswestry - a bit of a coup for the town as it 's part of a european tour .
i 've been to oswestry showground this morning to get a sneak preview of some of the bikes that will be involved .
author: Ian Perry
Reporter, BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: anti-discrimination group happy with black-faced dancing ban
text: an equality group says banning black-faced morris dancers from shrewsbury 's folk festival is the right decision , despite the practice 's long history .
fairness , respect , equality shropshire , or fresh contacted the festival 's organisers after receiving a complaint from a member of the public .
they also warned the organisers that they would support anyone who chose to take legal action if the dancers offended them .
jonathan hyams from the group says the key issue is their potential to upset people , who `` would not necessarily understand their tradition '' .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : anti-discrimination group pleased with ban ; shrewsbury out of the efl cup
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- equality group pleased with shrewsbury folk festival 's decision to ban black-faced morris dancers
- shrewsbury town crash out of the efl cup after a 1-0 loss at sunderland
- firefighters say a robot caused the fire at gkn sankey in telford

documents.title: sunderland 1-0 shrewsbury town
text: shrewsbury narrowly lost out to premier league opposition sunderland in the epl cup second round last night .
ivan toney had shrewsbury 's best effort , but was denied by jordan pickford .
in the end a late goal for adnan januzaj , his first for the club , was enough to seal the points for sunderland after a disjointed display .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: gkn sankey fire 'caused by robot '
text: a robot has been blamed for yesterday 's fire at gkn sankey 's factory .
the plant produces parts for the automotive industry and the robot in question is believed to have been making parts for a toyota vehicle .
nobody was hurt , but it took several hours to clear the smoke from the plant in hadley .
sparks from a spot welder went through the guard and set fire to cardboard boxes next to the machine . ''

documents.title: thousands set to receive gcse results
text: thousands of teenagers in shropshire will be among the half a million across the country up their gcse results today .
pass-rates are likely to have been affected by a high number of pupils who 've had to re-sit english and maths having failed to get a grade-c last year .
government plans in england to encourage more pupils to get gcses in maths and english required re-sits for tens of thousands who failed last year .

documents.title: event bans 'blackface ' morris dancers
text: event bans 'blackface ' morris dancers

documents.title: news : festival praised for black-faced dancer ban ; teens set for gcse results ; robot causes fire
text: this morning 's headlines :
- an equality group has praised the organisers of shrewsbury 's folk festival for deciding not to book black-faced morris dancers in future
- thousands of teenagers across shropshire are going to be getting their gcse results this morning
- firefighters say a robot was the cause of a fire at gkn sankey in telford
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: travel : roads looking clear
text: the roads are generally looking clear this morning , just the usual roadworks causing delays .
for a full round up on the county 's roads , take a look at bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

text: a damp start to the day but this morning should be mainly dry and cloudy before some further heavy and possibly thundery showers arrivethis afternoon .
highs of 22c ( 72f ) .

BBC Weather presenter

we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid message via facebook .
