text: sunderland 1-0 shrewsbury town

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: watch : preview of tonight 's shrewsbury town match
text: shrewsbury town have travelled to the north east today , to play sunderland in the efl cup .
we 've arrived early , to enjoy an ice cream by the seaside .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: plans to celebrate railway station anniversary
text: the 150th anniversary of shrewsbury 's abbey railway station will be celebrated with an open day , organised by the shrewsbury railway heritage trust .
the station opened on 13 august 1866 and was part of the potteries , shrewsbury and north wales line .
the trust 's celebratory event will be held on 10 september and will feature model railway displays , photographs and a visit from a direct descendant of robert stephenson .

documents.title: watch : bbc midlands today follows the route of the river severn
text: we 've filmed britain 's longest river , the severn , from the air - showing its sheer scale and impact on the landscape .
starting in wales and crossing shropshire , worcestershire , and gloucestershire the 220-mile-long river severn supplies water to six million people .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: weather : a cloudy night ahead for shropshire
text: the cloud which has been with us all day is set to continue through the night and we could have some rain tomorrow .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: your comments : morris dancers wearing black face paint
text: where do you stand on the decision of the shrewsbury folk festival to stop booking morris dancers who wear black face paint ?
there 's been a lot of debate on the bbc shropshire facebook page .
zoe marple is unhappy with the decision : `` they are black from mining , not to symbolise another race .
sooooo wrong to take offence and ban it '' .
norrie porter also sypmathised with organisers but wrote : `` i think the festival should support the tradition .
the absence of any link to racism could be explained in the programme '' .

documents.title: headlines : morris dancer decision praised ; attacks prompt body camera calls ; gkn reassures customers
text: our top stories this evening include :
- equalities group praises 'brave ' folk festival over morris dancer decision
- attacks on paramedics prompts calls for body cameras
- gkn reassures customers after telford factory fire
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : shrewsbury keeper says cup upset is possible
text: the shrewsbury town keeper jayson leutwiler believes his side can pull of an efl cup upset against sunderland tonight .
he said the team like to play in the cup competitions and he believed `` everything is possible '' .
sunderland have lost their first two premier league matches , but leutwiler warned that they are still a very good side .
we have to go with the mentality that we can win the game we have to be very concentrated and obviously take the chances we have . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: football : mellon looks for another cup upset
text: the shrewsbury town manager micky mellon sees tonight 's cup match against premier league sunderland as a `` great opportunity '' .
the club have pulled off a number of giant-killings in recent years and while he respects the ability of their opponents , he has faith in his own players too .
mellon said he knew what it meant to the club to pull off these shocks and also knew that the new sunderland manager , david moyes , is desperate for a win .
we 've got to believe that we can cause them problems and try and get something from the game . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: equalities group praises 'brave ' folk festival organisers
text: the equality and anti-discrimination group , fresh shropshire , has praised organisers of the shrewsbury folk festival for its decision to stop booking morris dancers who wear black face paint from next year .
it explained it contacted the festival after receiving a complaint from a member of the public last year .

that complaint had been about dancers in shrewsbury town centre , but it felt the festival should reconsider its decision to book similar acts , saying that while it acknowledged the tradition , the black face paint could be offensive to some .
the group said that it had held a meeting with the festival organisers to discuss the issue and had suggested the dancers use another colour of face paint or tried using patterned make-up instead .
the folk festival 's decision to phase out bookings is very brave and very much to be welcomed , because it shows a sensitivity to a changed social climate . ''

documents.title: nearly 300 attacks on paramedics in one year
text: body cameras could be issued to ambulance staff across the west midlands because of a rise in the number of attacks on paramedics .
there were 298 attacks on ambulance staff last year - that 's nearly a third more than in 2012 .
cctv cameras are already being fitted to vehicles to offer them extra protection from patients who are angry , drunk or on drugs .
author: Matthew Bone
Reporter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: your comments : morris dancers with black face paint
text: the decision to put a stop to morris dancers wearing black face-paint at the shrewsbury folk festival has got you talking on the bbc shropshire facebook site .
michael watkins writes : `` good old do gooders and politically correct .
why does everything have to be spoiled by those who find offence with thing done .
the blacked up faces are from the 16th century .
good old english tradition . ''
and mikey day added : `` it 's nothing to do with race .
people need to grow up and stop assuming everything is offensive .
very frustrating ! ''
richard day wrote : `` just because we have done something for a long time does not necessarily mean we should continue it unless you want to bring back the burning of witches maybe ? ''
feel free to have your say .

documents.title: hay fire at prees heath
text: firefighters are dealing with a fire involving around 100 bales of straw at farm near prees heath .
they were called out at 13:32 and one fire engine from whitchurch is still there .

documents.title: gkn offer reassurances after telford fire
text: gkn sankey says the fire at its factory in hadley last night will not affect its ability to supply customers .
the fire in a maintenance store took dozens of firefighters an hour to bring under control .
the company has also said health and safety is its number one priority .

documents.title: headlines : atkinson investigation could take nine months ; cameras for paramedics ; morris dancer face paint controversy
text: here 's a recap of our top stories this afternoon :
- investigation into dalian atkinson death to take nine months
- ambulance staff could get body cameras
- shrewsbury folk festival to stop booking morris dancers wearing black face paint
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : shropshire man remembers failed russian coup
text: it 's 25 years since the failed attempt to depose mikhail gorbachev as leader of the soviet union and michael underwood from albrighton has been sharing his memories of it .
he was in russia at the time and went to take photos of the barricades and the tanks .
you can hear more from michael on our breakfast programme from 06:00 tomorrow morning .
author: Eric and Clare's Breakfast Show

documents.title: mp paterson calls for shropshire to be included in new badger cull
text: shropshire should be included in areas selected for controversial badger culls according to county mp owen paterson .
author: North Shropshire Chronicle

documents.title: photos : cleaning cosford 's cold war museum
text: workmen are up on cherry- cleaning the side of raf cosford 's cold war museum today .
if you 've been there , you will know what a big task that is , because the building is huge .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: photos : first patients treated at new £ 15m hospital unit
text: part of new £ 15m unit at the robert jones and agnes hunt hospital has been treating its first patients today .
work on the theatres and wards has taken over a year so far and the baschurch day unit is now open , but other parts of the development are still in construction .
the first operation is scheduled to take place next tuesday .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: 'unstoppable army making things happen ' # bbcunsunghero
text: still not sure what the bbc get inspired unsung hero award is about ?
let clare balding explain
send us in your suggestions for your sporting unsung hero by tweeting using the hashtag # bbcunsunghero

documents.title: football : shrewsbury part ways with midfielder wellens
text: shrewsbury town say midfielder richie wellens has left the club after an agreement to cancel his contract .
the experienced 36-year-old made 12 appearances for the club last season , but manager micky mellon told him he was n't part of their rebuilding plans .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: call for action after falling tree just misses children in bridgnorth
text: a councillor has called for action after a tree fell on a road in bridgnorth , just missing passing pedestrians .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: headlines : atkinson inquest opens ; cameras for paramedics ; black-faced morris dancer ban
text: our top stories this lunchtime include :
- inquest opens into death of dalian atkinson
- ambulance service could introduce body cameras for paramedics
- folk festival to call time on black-faced morris dancers
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather watchers : thick cloud covering shropshire
text: the photos from the bbc weather watchers so far today have had one common theme - thick grey cloud .
here you can see photos taken near ludlow and kinnersley .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: telford man died in m6 crash
text: a telford man died in a crash on the m6 on sunday , it 's emerged .
anthony marston had been towing a van on a trailer , when there was a collision that closed the motorway for several hours .
he leaves a widow , sue , and two children .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: tasered footballer had cpr for 35 minutes
text: tasered footballer had cpr for 35 minutes

documents.title: weather : light cloud across shropshire today
text: there might be some sunshine around this afternoon , but it will be mostly cloudy across shropshire .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: watch : big increase in attacks on paramedics
text: i 've been looking at whether paramedics need protection after a big rise in the number of assaults over the past four years .
you can see more in midlands today , on bbc one at 13:30 and 18:30 .
author: Matthew Bone
Political reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: dalian atkinson investigation to take nine months
text: the investigation into the death of dalian atkinson by the independent police complaints commission will take nine months , an inquest into his death has been told .
mr atkinson had been tasered by police - two officers have been suspended while a criminal investigation is carried out .
the inquest , which opened this morning , also heard that doctors had tried to give mr atkinson cpr for 35 minutes , before he was pronounced dead at telford 's princess royal hospital .

documents.title: fire at gkn sankey factory
text: dozens of firefighters were called to a fire at gkn sankey in telford , during the night .
at its height , 11 fire appliances were called to the factory in hadley .
people living near the factory were advised to keep their windows closed , because of the smoke .
the fire , in a maintenance store , took around an hour and a half to bring under control .

documents.title: football : moyes returns to shrewsbury for cup tie
text: shrewsbury town are away to premier league sunderland in round two of the efl cup tonight .
they have a reputation for giant-killing in recent years and tonight they come up against a former player who went on to bigger things - david moyes .
moyes says he knows the shrewsbury manager micky mellon and that they `` play good stuff '' , so it will be a difficult game for his side .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: black faced morris dancers causing controversy for shrewsbury folk festival
text: the organisers of shrewsbury folk festival say this year 's event will be the last to feature blacked-up morris dancers .
groups who practice this border morris tradition that dates back up to 500 years say the use of black face-paint or soot has no racial connotations .
it was originally used as a way of disguising dancers so they could n't be recognised , folk festival organisers say .
however , they add that they must change with the times and will not book them in the future .
we are caught in the middle .
we 've been contacted by an organisation that has asked us not to book them and we 've been contacted by people who are upset because we are not booking them . ''
author: James Fanning
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: breakingdalian atkinson inquest opens
text: an inquest has opened into the death of the former aston villa footballer , dalian atkinson .

mr atkinson , of holly road in the dawley area of telford , died shortly after being tasered outside his father 's home in the town just over a week ago and a full inquest has now been scheduled for three months ' time .
his death is the subject of an investigation by the independent police complaints commission and two police officers have been suspended .
no cause of death was given this morning and more tests have been ordered after an initial post-mortem examination proved inconclusive .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : fire at gkn factory ; body cameras for paramedics ; atkinson inquest
text: our top stories this morning :
- fire at gkn sankey factory in telford
- plan to equip ambulance staff with body cameras
- inquest into death of dalian atkinson opens
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: trott recognises unsung heroes # bbcunsunghero
text: double rio olympic gold medallist laura trott knows the importance of sporting volunteers and wants you to nominate yours

documents.title: paramedics body cameras : 'it is something we are seriously considering '
text: body cameras for ambulance staff is `` something we are seriously considering '' , according to the head of security for west midlands ambulance service ( wmas ) .
there 's been a steep rise in the number of attacks on paramedics - up from 82 to 129 in the last four years in the west mercia area .

we have already got cctv on our vehicles , both external and internal , and we 're doing some research now into looking at the possibility of using portable body-worn cctv cameras - it 's still in the research stage but it is something we are seriously considering . ''

documents.title: calls for young people to enjoy the big outdoors
text: a project in clee hill , near ludlow , is hoping to encourage children to connect with nature .
the clee young rangers scheme sees children building their own stone age village , learning how to make fires , forage for food and go on virtual hunts .
run by the shropshire youth forum it has received support from the heritage lottery fund for two years .
what we 're trying to do is get young people to appreciate nature and the outdoors , if they start doing that now they 'll pass on their knowledge to future generations . ''
author: James Fanning
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: # bbcunsungheronominate your local sports volunteer hero now !
text: today we 'll be talking about the launch of the bbc get inspired unsung hero award 2016 .
do you know a local sports volunteer who deserves recognition for their tireless efforts in helping people to participate in sport ?

well , now 's your chance to give them their time to shine by nominating them for a prestigious award - one which is one of the highlights of this year 's televised sports personality of the year awards .

the winner could be anyone from a local sports club manager , volunteer , kit person or coach - if they have demonstrated a commitment to promoting sport in their local community then they could become this year 's winner .
nominate your chosen champion on the get inspired website - and join in the conversation online with # bbcunsunghero .

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast
text: it 'll be a bright start with sunny spells .
cloud will increase over the course of the day .
there 's the chance of occasional , isolated showers towards this evening but for most it 'll remain dry .
highs of 23c ( 73f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: headlines : fire at gkn ; ambulance staff may wear body cameras ; inquest to open after footballer death
text: here are a few of the stories we 're focusing on this morning :
- dozens of firefighters were called to a fire at gkn sankey in telford , during the night .
- ambulance staff in shropshire may be equipped with body cameras after a rise in attacks on staff
- an inquest into the death of the former aston villa footballer dalian atkinson is due to open this morning in shrewsbury
author: James Fanning
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ambulance staff may get body cameras after a steep rise in attacks
text: west midlands ambulance service are considering introducing body cameras after a rise in the number of their ambulance staff being attacked .
the number of attacks in the west mercia area , which includes shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire rose from 82 to 129 between april 2012 and march 2016 .
physical assaults went up from 21 to 56 in the same period - 19 of those attacks involved people who were drunk .

documents.title: travel : a few problems on the roads this morning
text: there 's slow traffic and one lane is closed on the a5 westbound in shrewsbury after dobbies island , because of a broken-down lorry .
just over the border in worcestershire , there 's also slow traffic on the a456 in long bank at the lye head road junction in the roadworks area .
there are a few roadworks across shropshire to be aware of .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning - welcome to live updates for the day
text: welcome to local live in shropshire , we are here with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do you have a story or a to share ?
you can get in touch on email , facebook or twitter .
author: James Fanning
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back from 08:00 on wednesday with more news , sport , travel and weather , but keep checking here for updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: cricket : shropshire presence at worcester
text: shropshire cricket supporters have long since learned to keep eyes trained across the county border on worcestershire these days , given the long trail of locally-reared talent that has pitched up at new road , worcester .
but worcestershire 's current game against northamptonshire , which started today , is a particular source of pride .
the entire worcestershire pace attack is all-shropshire - ed barnard , jack shantry and vice-captain joe leach .
there is still england lions batsman joe clarke to come and even one of the northants players , fast bowler ben sanderson , used to play for shropshire .
and , on top of that , one of the umpires is former shropshire opening batsman ( and oswestry golf club member ) steve gale .

documents.title: appeal after m54 crash
text: police are appealing for information after a three-car crash on the m54 last week which closed the westbound carriageway between junctions 5 and 6 for about two hours .
the collision at about 10:00 on wednesday involved a silver mercedes , a black renault twingo and a blue mercedes .
the driver of the blue car , a man in his 70s , and a passenger in the vehicle , a woman in her 70s , were taken to hospital .
two adults and three children in another car were treated at the scene .
police are appealing for witnesses to dial 101 and ask for central motorway police group .
author: Nigel Dolman
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : west midlands weather
text: staying fine and very warm this evening , with plenty more sunshine to end the day .
all parts will remain dry but it will feel rather humid overnight , particularly towards shrewsbury .
lows of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Kay Crewdson
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: midlands today : fatal grenade attack and paralympian seeking gold
text: this evening on bbc midlands today we 'll have more on a grenade attack in sweden that killed a boy from the west midlands .
we 'll also feature a west midlands paralympian , ian marsden , who says team gb 's olympic success has inspired him to go for gold in rio .
join me for bbc midlands today at 18:30 .
author: Nick Owen
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: headlines : m6 crash victim was from telford ; 'cuts threat ' to nursing home beds ; player quits afc telford united
text: today 's headlines include :
- man who died in m6 crash was telford father-of-two
- concern that beds at a shropshire nursing home could be cut
- midfielder michael monaghan quits afc telford united
author: Nigel Dolman
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ludlow parking row : night-time crackdown must continue , say council bosses
text: night-time parking enforcement in ludlow town centre must continue according to council bosses - despite calls for a change of strategy .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: tribute to telford man who died in m6 crash
text: the family of a telford father-of-two who died in a collision on the m6 on sunday says he `` lived life to the full '' .
the motorway was closed for several hours following the crash between junctions 10 and 10a on the northbound carriageway at about 15:00 .
in a tribute released by west midlands police , mr marston 's family said : `` tony was a loving father to laura and luke and husband to sue .
`` he lived life to the full , he was one of life 's original characters who will be deeply missed by all who knew him . ''
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather watchers : norton
text: you can send photos to bbc weather watchers - this one , of norton , is from ice queen .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: monaghan quits afc telford united
text: midfielder michael monaghan has quit afc telford united - citing a lack of game-time for the bucks .
monaghan only joined them in the summer , having impressed for burscough in the evo-stik league .
the 20-year-old 's made two sub appearances this season , but was tipped by telford manager rob smith for a bright future .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: telford man died in m6 crash
text: a man who died in a crash on the m6 on sunday was a married father-of-two from telford .
anthony marston , 54 , was pronounced dead at the scene of the crash between junctions 10 and 10a on the northbound carriageway at about 15:00 bst , west midlands police says .
mr marston was driving a white mercedes e300 estate and had been towing a trailer loaded with a peugeot partner van along the m6 northbound .
the collision involved a heavy goods vehicle and a gantry was also badly damaged .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fantasy garden opens for sparc in bishops castle
text: a fantasy garden will be on show to help to save a sports and leisure centre in bishop 's castle .
author: Ludlow & Tenbury Wells Advertiser

documents.title: weather watchers : photos
text: our weather watchers have been busy taking photos .
this photo from kinnersley comes from can you see the wrekin ?
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: headlines : 'cuts threat ' to nursing home beds ; council defends parking decision ; player quits afc telford united
text: today 's headlines include :
- concern that beds at a shropshire nursing home could be cut
- shropshire council defends its decision to crack down on parking in ludlow
- midfielder michael monaghan quits afc telford united
author: Nigel Dolman
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: life and works of shrewsbury-born stained glass artist to be celebrated in new exhibition
text: an artist from shrewsbury whose stained glass windows can be seen in churches around the world is to be celebrated this autumn in a major new exhibition of her work at shrewsbury museum & art gallery .
author: Shropshire Live

documents.title: riley bids for more assists
text: you may have heard the shrewsbury town manager micky mellon yesterday praising the pace of new loan signing mo choulay down the wing .
well joe riley ( above ) is looking to do the same .
the full-back , who signed from bury over the summer and has played for bolton , says his natural game is to get forward and help set up goals .
i played [ on the ] wing a couple of times , but [ i 'm ] predominantly a right back .
i got a few assists last year and personal targets i want to try and double that this year .
they are a massive part of my game . ''
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shrewsbury fields forever : anger vented over axed festival
text: ticket holders and business leaders have hit out over the treatment of customers following the cancellation of shrewsbury fields forever .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: japanese tourists 'played part in saving the iron bridge '
text: it 's being claimed a group of japanese tourists played their part in preventing shropshire 's world-famous iron bridge from being demolished .
in 1956 the then salop county council put forward a proposal to replace the structure .
graham hickman 's family used to run the grocers which is now the ironbridge gorge museum shop .
he says japanese tourists were visiting the bridge at the same time as councillors - and may have changed minds .
they saw this party of official-looking people here discussing the future of the bridge .
they up that there ( were ) plans to demolish the bridge .
these japanese gentlemen said when they were students at university , the building of the iron bridge was discussed in books and in their college and university classes . ''
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : grenade attack and paralympian seeking gold
text: this lunchtime on bbc midlands today we 'll have more on a grenade attack in sweden that killed a boy from the west midlands .
you 'll also hear from a local paralympian who says team gb 's success is inspiring his own quest for gold in rio .
those stories and more on bbc one from 13:30 .
author: Nicola Beckford
Reporter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: raiders steal £ 2,500 in goods from telford pet shop
text: burglars stole more than £ 2,500 worth of goods and caused £ 1,000 damage to a pet shop in telford .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: headlines : 'cuts threat ' to nursing home beds ; council defends parking decision ; comedian 's joke makes top list
text: here are some of the stories today :
- concern that beds at a shropshire nursing home could be cut
- shropshire council is defending its decision to crack down on parking in ludlow
- telford comedian 's gag named in edinburgh fringe funniest jokes list
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: marmite joke is 12th best - and you 'll either love it or hate it
text: the top 15 funniest jokes at the edinburgh fringe festival have been announced and a shropshire comedian has made the list .
the festival 's `` best jokes '' were selected by a panel of 10 judges before being put to 2,000 people , who voted for their favourite .
roger swift 's gag about marmite came in at number 12 .
and here it is
i spotted a marmite van on the motorway .
it was heading yeastbound ''

documents.title: council defends decision over parking
text: shropshire council is defending its decision to crack down on parking in ludlow .
its enforcement officers have been issuing tickets to people who are parked in the market square after 18:00 .

it said on 5 july , 49 notices were issued , with 31 relating to infringements after 18:00 , while on 9 august , 25 were issued , with 19 being after 18:00 - a fall which means , the authority says , the practice is working .
but town councillor andy boddington said the number of fines issued in the evening was making people `` really , really angry '' .
he said : `` people tend to park around the town centre area , around the market square , on the side streets , not always in positions that are legal but they 've done it for years . ''

documents.title: cheltenham festival : former shrewsbury town striker james collins banned from racecourses after 'urination ' incident
text: two professional footballers , including a former shrewsbury town striker , who apparently urinated into a glass at the cheltenham festival have been banned from attending racecourses in britain .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: river severn up by a metre after weekend rain
text: the wet weather we had over the weekend has had a significant effect on the river severn in shrewsbury .
river severn # shrewsbury showing response to weekend rain in wales .
up a metre .
no problems just some welcome water !
image from @ twitterid 3000+ gauges across uk .
check gauges near you also including @ twitterid cameras

documents.title: concern over cuts threat to nursing home beds
text: there 's concern that cuts to health services could threaten beds at a shropshire nursing home .
shropshire clinical commissioning group is looking to make savings of £ 3m , which may mean `` gp beds '' at the lady forester home in much wenlock have to close .
shropshire 's ccg is looking into how it can provide `` the most effective use of public money '' .
earlier this month , it highlighted several areas where it felt there may be opportunities to cut costs .
four beds at the lady forester home were initially part of a project created by gps 10 years ago to provide post-hospital discharge provision for the community .
they have all been occupied over the last 12 months .
local conservative councillor david turner says they are a `` value for money facility '' and does n't want to see them sacrificed as a `` quick financial fix '' .
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: rio paralym debut for shropshire wheelchair racer
text: shropshire wheelchair racer ben rowlings believes the gb paralympic squad in rio can do better than it did at london 2012 .
the newport athlete - who 's making his games debut in the 100 and 800 metres - flies out to brazil this week .
he says despite the worries over funding , paralympic sport is at an all-time high .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: headlines : criticism over ludlow night-time parking charges ; shropshire comedian 's marmite joke makes top list
text: our top stories this morning :
- shropshire council is defending its decision to crack down on parking in ludlow
- former shropshire council employee pleads not guilty to a charge of fraud
- telford comedian 's gag named in edinburgh fringe funniest jokes list
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: call for review into night-time parking
text: shropshire council 's being criticised for issuing tickets to people who 've parked in ludlow 's market square after 18:00 .
the local authority says its approach , `` whilst unpopular for some , is working '' as it tries to address `` identified parking problems '' .
local councillors say they want a halt to the campaign , except where people are parking dangerously or blocking disabled access .
shropshire council says night-time parking restrictions , in place since july , has led to a fall in illegal and indiscriminate parking in the town .

documents.title: travellers leave shrewsbury 's frankwell car park
text: travellers have been moved on from a shrewsbury town centre car park .
shropshire council said the group was asked to leave frankwell car park on friday .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: weather watchers : a sunny start across shropshire
text: our weather watchers have captured some stunning already this morning .
it 's going to be a very warm and sunny day for the county .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: headlines : criticism over evening parking tickets ; 'we 'll beat 2012 medal tally ' says wheelchair racer
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- ludlow councillors call for review into evening parking problems
- concern that beds at a shropshire nursing home could be cut
- shropshire paralympian ben rowlings believes the gb squad can do better in rio than it did at london 2012
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : very warm and sunny
text: a return to summer today , plenty of sunny spells and high temperatures .
kay has the forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : slow traffic around shrewsbury
text: a couple of incidents to be aware of on the roads this morning .
the a5 is partially blocked at the emstrey island after a car collided with the central reservation .
and there 's been a crash outside tesco on battlefield road near harlescott lane .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning : live updates for shropshire
text: i 'm in the bbc shropshire newsroom bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you spot something happening in your local area which you think we should know about you can email , tweet us or comment on facebook .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: weather : a cloudy night ahead for shropshire
text: this evening and tonight it 's going to remain cloudy across shropshire , with the chance of the odd shower .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: man who raided bridgnorth pub for cash and fruit machines jailed
text: a man involved in a burglary in which cash and gaming machines were taken from a village pub has been jailed .
author: Bridgnorth Journal

documents.title: more than 800 people apply for 81 apprentice places
text: the water company severn trent says it is tripling its intake of apprentices this year , adding the largest number of new recruits the company has ever taken on .
more than 800 people applied for the scheme and 81 were recruited .
the apprentices will train in a variety of engineering and digital roles .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: concern about shrewsbury flax mill car park
text: some people who live near the old flax mill at ditherington in shrewsbury are calling for a rethink over access plans for a car-park .
they 're worried that the multimillion-pound restoration of the historic building will result in too many cars using a local cul-de-sac - marshalls court .
historic england is behind the application , but said no-one was available to comment today .

documents.title: tennis club to take part in national sporting celebrations
text: the shrewsbury club is taking part in a national day of sport , to mark the achievements of our athletes at rio .
it 's offering visitors to its home on the outskirts of shrewsbury the chance to try out tennis , football , rugby and cricket for free .
the event is taking place on saturday 27 august and shrewsbury town are also getting involved , giving away 500 tickets to their match being played that afternoon .

documents.title: weather watchers : dark skies in shropshire this afternoon
text: this photo was taken a couple of hours ago in chirbury and sent in by one of the bbc weather watchers .
it 's been a cloudy afternoon all over shropshire and it 's forecast to remain like that until the end of the week .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: west midlands clinical trials : half-a-million people take part in 10 years
text: more than half a million people in the west midlands have taken part in clinical trials in the last decade - a greater number of participants than anywhere else in the country .
drugs firms are choosing this area to carry out trials because of the diverse population and the number of hospitals and universities involved in medical research .
for patients , it gives access to new drugs and treatments not available on the nhs and more on this story on bbc midlands today at 18:30 .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: headlines : former council worker denied fraud ; owen smith cancels visit ; stained glass exhibition
text: our top stories this evening include :
- former shropshire council worker pleads not guilty to fraud
- labour leadership hopeful owen smith cancels telford visit
- display of work by shrewsbury stained glass artist
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: former council worker denies fraud
text: a former employee of shropshire council and it 's private arm , ip & e , has pleaded not guilty to a charge of fraud by abuse of position .
penelope rian wilkinson is accused of abusing her position as communications and marketing manager at ip & e in an attempt to dishonestly make £ 14,800 for herself .
the 42-year-old from sandbach in cheshire pleaded not guilty and the case moves on to shrewsbury crown court next month .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : england reassurances for hart
text: it 's been an uncertain time for the former shrewsbury goalkeeper joe hart , after he lost the number one jersey at man city , but he 's had some good news today .
england manager sam allardyce says goalkeeper hart will `` definitely '' be in his squad for next month 's world cup qualifier against slovakia .
hart is yet to make an appearance for manchester city this season and has been told he can leave the club if he wants to by new manager pep guardiola .

documents.title: weather watchers : clouds over shropshire
text: this photo from one of our bbc weather watchers is brilliant , because every cloud appears to be different .
we have the puffy , dark clouds near the horizon , the scattering of small cotton-wool balls in the middle , right the way up to the hazy cloud at the top of the

documents.title: more than 100 hit with fines over evening parking in ludlow
text: calls have been made for night-time parking enforcement in ludlow town centre to be suspended after more than 100 drivers were hit with fines .
author: Shrewsbury Chronicle

documents.title: paralym wheelchair racer confident ahead of rio
text: the newport wheelchair racer ben rowlings has told us he is in the `` best possible shape '' ahead of the rio paralym
the 20-year-old won three bronze medals at the recent european championships and will be competing in the 100 and 800 metre events .
he will be flying out to brazil soon to join the rest of the gb team in bela horizonte .

documents.title: breakingowen smith cancels telford visit
text: the labour leadership candidate owen smith has cancelled his visit to telford , blaming heavy traffic on the m6 .
dozens of his supporters have packed dawley town hall for the rally and he was due to arrive at 14:30 .

documents.title: headlines : atkinson inquest opening ; small increase in v fest injuries ; owen smith visits
text: here 's a recap of our top stories :
- dalian atkinson inquest to open on wednesday
- small increase in numbers injured at v festival
- labour leadership candidate owen smith visiting telford
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: photos : exhibition of work by shrewsbury stained-glass artist
text: a shrewsbury artist whose stained glass windows can be seen in churches around the world is having her work celebrated in a new exhibition .
margaret rope , who was born in 1882 , led a colourful life and was known for riding a motorbike , smoking cigars and having her hair cut short , shropshire council says .
the exhibition will take place at shrewsbury museum and art gallery from 12 september until 15 january and will include projections of some of her most famous works .

documents.title: hay bales alight outside shrewsbury
text: firefighters in shrewsbury are currently tackling a blaze involving 250 hay bales alight on farmland in preston gubbals .

documents.title: man hired as a gardener for massive cannabis operation jailed
text: an albanian man hired as a gardener for a massive cannabis growing operation at a house in telford has been jailed .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: labour leadership candidate visiting telford
text: the labour party leadership candidate owen smith is visiting telford this afternoon .
he is expected to speak to supporters at dawley town hall at 14:30 .
last week , his leadership rival , jeremy corbyn , pulled out of a planned rally in oakengates .

documents.title: football : tns return to the top of the table
text: the new saints return to top spot in the welsh premier after a 5-0 win over llandudno .
the goals came from sergeant , quigley , brobbel and adrian cieslewicz , who suffered a nasty head injury and had to be carted off to hospital .
assistant manager scott ruscoe said that despite the wind conditions , he thought his side were on top from the very first minute .

documents.title: photos : a 360-degree view of the v festival at weston park
text: the sun came out ( eventually ) at the v festival and we took a few photos of the crowds enjoying themselves .
if you go to our facebook page , you can see a 360-degree photo of the site .

documents.title: dalian atkinson inquest due to open on wednesday
text: an inquest into the death of dalian atkinson is set to open in shrewsbury on wednesday .
the former aston villa striker died shortly after being tasered at his father 's house in telford last week .
two police officers are under criminal investigation after the death of the 48-year-old .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: man appears in court on murder charge
text: a man 's appeared in court charged with the murder of a 16-year-old in the meole brace area of shrewsbury .
declan graves , who is 19 and from dymchurch road in liverpool , will be held in custody until his trial at stafford crown court in february .
michael warham , from liverpool , was found by a member of the public with a stab wound in wayford close on 1 august and died later in hospital .

documents.title: watch : festival-goers enjoy the sunshine at weston park
text: the wet weather does n't seem to have spoiled the atmosphere at weston park for this summer 's v festival .
here are some of the scenes from the weekend .
author: Adam Crowther
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : man in court over shrewsbury murder ; small explosion at v fest camp site ; owen smith visits
text: here are our top stories this lunchtime :
- man appears in court charged with meole brace murder
- small explosion in tent at weston park
- labour leadership hopeful owen smith visiting telford
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: slavery reports rise fivefold , salvation army says
text: just over 13 % of `` modern slavery '' victims helped by the salvation army in 2015/16 were referred from the west midlands , according to new data .
the charity says it supported 1,805 people in england and wales during the period - nearly a five-fold increase in the number since 2012 .

anne read , director of anti-trafficking and modern slavery at the salvation army , said the nature of the crime meant it was `` always difficult to know the full extent of the problem '' and the increase in referrals could be because there were more victims but also `` improvements in training and awareness-raising '' .

documents.title: weather : cloud remaining for the rest of the day
text: it 's going to be cloudy for the rest of the day , but the rain should stay away .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: 'tent explosion ' at v festival
text: nobody has been injured in a `` tent explosion '' at v festival , an ambulance worker says .
liz parkes is one of west midlands ambulance services medics at the 2016 event which is winding down today .
she tweeted that the fire service onsite had `` dealt with '' the explosion .
we 'll bring you more information as we get it .
just responded to a tent explosion on site , luckily no-one injured and the onsite fire service dealt with it

documents.title: football : curzon ashton 1-1 afc telford united
text: afc telford united left curzon ashton with a point after coming from behind to draw 1-1 .
the bucks were poor in the first half and curzon took advantage as niall cummins got in behind the telford defence to easily side-foot the opener .

rob smith introduced micah evans and danny reynolds after the break and it was the two substitutes who combined brilliantly to equalise - evans pulling the ball back after a great run for reynolds to make no mistake .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: v festival : increase in festival-goers needing medical treatment
text: more than 1,200 people needed medical treatment at the v festival in staffordshire at the weekend , according to the ambulance service .
the wet weather led to many people getting hurt due to slips , trips and falls , west midlands ambulance service says .
a number were also treated for drinking too much alcohol .
the service says the total treated was 1,218 , an increase on 2015 - 40 were taken to hospital for more treatment .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: vyrnwy flood alert lifted
text: a flood alert for the river vyrnwy has been lifted by the environment agency
it was put in place after heavy rain at the weekend .

documents.title: cricket : shrewsbury second after victory
text: shrewsbury now lie second in the birmingham league premier division after beating barnt green by 91 runs .
in the lower divisions , there were wins for wellington and shifnal .
in the shropshire premier league , frankton beat st georges , sentinel drew with albrighton , broseley beat shelton and madeley claimed a win against forton .
ludlow 's match with bomere heath was abandoned .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury get first league win of the season
text: skipper adam el-abd headed a late winner as shrewsbury beat chesterfield 2-1 to up their first league one win of the season .
chesterfield struck first when jay o'shea drove confidently home from 15 yards in the 14th minute .
shrewsbury responded well and equalised with their first league goal of the season thanks to a header from left-back junior brown .
shrewsbury grabbed the winner six minutes from time when adam el-abd powerfully headed in jim o'brien 's corner from the right .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: more than 500,000 take part in clinical trials in west midlands
text: the west midlands has more people involved in clinical trials than anywhere else in the country .
more than 500,000 people in our region have taken part in clinical trials in the last decade - giving them access to new drugs and treatments not available on the nhs .
drugs firms are choosing the region to carry out trials because of the diverse population - and the number of hospitals and universities involved in medical research .

documents.title: travel : slow-moving traffic on roads around weston park
text: the v festival traffic is still clearing around weston park .
and that means slow-moving traffic on the a5 and a41 , near the site .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: man due in court over shrewsbury murder
text: a man is appearing at stafford crown court charged with the murder of a 16-year-old .
michael warham , from liverpool , was found by a member of the public with a stab wound in wayford close in meole brace on 1 august .
declan graves , 19 , of dymchurch road , liverpool has been charged with murder .

documents.title: the big clean up under way at v festival
text: the clean up for the 21st v festival is under way this morning .
tens of thousands of people flocked to weston park to see some of the biggest artists over the last three days .
organisers say it was a great weekend .

documents.title: headlines : man in court over shrewsbury murder ; v festival clear-up begins
text: our top stories this morning :
- man due to appear at stafford crown court charged with the murder of a 16-year-old
- big clear-up begins at v festival
- flood alert issued for severn vyrnwy catchment area
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : not too bad outside weston park
text: we sent our reporter les to check on the usually busy traffic situation outside weston park this morning .
traditionally the main routes surrounding the park , including the a5 , a41 and a449 are busy with festival-goers making their way home after the v festival .
but it was n't bad at all .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: thunderbirds puppet goes for £ 19,000
text: a lady penelope puppet used in the hit tv show thunderbirds has sold for £ 19,000 at auction .
it was discovered at the bottom of a wardrobe wrapped in a blanket after a science-fiction memorabilia collector died , trevanion & dean auctioneers said .
the puppet was sold at an auction in whitchurch over the weekend .

documents.title: on air : your best celebration or festival
text: ryan kennedy is in for jim hawkins on air until midday and wants to know what 's the best celebration or festival you 've been to or been involved with ?
maybe you were at the london 2012 closing ceremony , maybe it was something you did for a big birthday or anniversary .
you can get in touch with the show by calling 01743 248321 or text 81333 starting your message with the word shrop .
or you can get in touch via facebook and twitter .
author: Ryan Kennedy
Presenter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: rihanna and bieber rock v festival
text: rihanna and bieber rock v festival

documents.title: headlines : man due in court over shrewsbury murder ; thousands head home after v festival
text: our top stories this morning :
- a 19-year-old man is due to appear at shrewsbury crown court charged with murder
- a flood alert is in force for the vyrnwy catchment area
- the big clear-up at the v festival begins today
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cloudy with some showers
text: staying cloudy today , but mild with some scattered showers .
charlie has the forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : v festival traffic causing delays
text: routes around weston park , including the a5 , a41 and a449 are busy this morning as traffic leaves the v festival .
author: BBC Travel
